verses.name: Job 4:1
verses.text: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,

verses.name: Job 4:2
verses.text: If we assay to commune with thee, wilt thou be grieved? but who can withhold himself from speaking?

verses.name: Job 4:3
verses.text: Behold, thou hast instructed many, and thou hast strengthened the weak hands.

verses.name: Job 4:4
verses.text: Thy words have upholden him that was falling, and thou hast strengthened the feeble knees.

verses.name: Job 4:5
verses.text: But now it is come upon thee, and thou faintest; it toucheth thee, and thou art troubled.

verses.name: Job 4:6
verses.text: Is not this thy fear, thy confidence, thy hope, and the uprightness of thy ways?

verses.name: Job 4:7
verses.text: Remember, I pray thee, who ever perished, being innocent? or where were the righteous cut off?
